Dialogs.Dialog: Rinko
Recently, many people have been forgetting to return their books to the library. Have you noticed？
Is that so…？
You haven't noticed？ Are you not taking your job on the library committee seriously？
I'm trying. I'm showing up, right？
It's not enough to just show up. Come on.
Alright, alright. But how many people are forgetting to return them？
Glad we got that clear. So, for those who often show up there, I'll give you a heads up…
Often showing up, huh？ At this rate, the number of books we have will decrease drastically.
Right！ It's such a disappointment when you go to borrow a book and the book you want isn't there.
Okay. I'll think of something to do.
That would be very helpful if you could.
Rinko
▲主人公＊▲. I went to a class yesterday of people who don't return books.
You're a hard worker.
That's because you're not there when I need you.
Sorry… So, what happened？ I'm assuming you got them back, right？
Yeah. I got them back. But the guy I had to coerce them from was a total jerk.
Seriously？ What did he do to you？
Hmm. You're worried about me, huh？
… That's a given.
Thanks. But I'm fine. I was just being facetious.
I was going to return them today, but I figured I'd better not lie to…
Wouldn't it be better to find a way to change the mindset of the people borrowing the books？
I guess so.
Rinko
Remember the people who aren't returning their books？
Did you go try to get them back alone again？
Yeah. But there's no end in sight.
I bet there's a lot of people who forget they even borrowed books in the first place.
They aren't considering that the books in the library belong to everyone.
Well, I borrowed one a long time ago and totally forgot about it for quite a while…
Ouch！
I should fire you from the library committee.
How about we put posters up in the school？ If we call out the whole school, some people will remember.
... I see. That's not a bad idea. I'll talk to our superiors about it.
Rinko
You know how we talked about putting posters up the other day？
After discussing it with the seniors, I put a simple one in the hallway for now.
Yeah, I saw that. It's the one up at the entrance to the library, right？
Yeah.
So, did it have any effect…？
That seemed to work pretty well on its own.
After school, there was a line at the return counter.
Great！ That's good to know. So the problem's solved, eh？
It's not that easy. It might only be effective for now.
I see. You're a hard worker, ▲小早川＊▲.
You're an idiot. Rinko is just doing what should have been done when it was first noticed. But…
I want to work harder and get more recognition. Maybe… Hehe.
Rinko
The other day, a girl in my class brought me some homemade cookies.
Making sweets is a girly hobby.
But you know, all the boys were all delirious as they are. I couldn't watch them.
Even the homeroom teacher was happy to eat them, so it's the end of the world.
Your homeroom teacher is a guy, right？ You've got to forgive him. That's just how us men are wired.
They're just cookies. Anyone can make them.
The fact that they're homemade is more important than the taste.
Yeah. So you like the type of girl who can bake sweets？
Sure. Especially when they do their best to make them despite whether or not they're any good at it.
… Why are you looking at me like that？ I can at least make cookies.
Rinko
You know how we were talking about the girl who was baking cookies the other day？
Yeah. I'm sure she's gained some popularity with the guys since then, huh？
No, not really. Rather, she's gotten really popular amongst the girls.
Why's that？
All the girls suddenly wanted her to teach them how to bake. And they're all delicious.
Hmm. That's a surprising turn of events.
Right？ I heard that she's going to have a baking party at her house after school.
And ▲小早川＊▲'s not going？
… You're correct. That's not in Rinko's character, right？
What a waste. I wish I could have tried some cookies you would have made.
… Oh, yeah.
Rinko
To humor myself, I'm going to participate in a baking workshop.
Really？ Didn't you say you weren't going to participate the other day？
It's weird that Rinko is the only one in the class who's not joining in.
（Wow. The ▲小早川＊▲ I first met would never have participated in something like this…）
What？
Nothing. I was just thinking to myself how much I'm looking forward to your cookies.
No one said anything about me feeding you.
Unfair！
… I can't help it. If I screw some up, I'll give them to you.
What？ No samples of successful batches？
I'll try to consider it.
Rinko
Here you go. I spent a study session making cookies.
You look proud of your work. Oh, neat！ You even wrapped them up all nice and tidy！ They look good.
But you haven't even opened… Eh, I'm not going into all the details.
Is that right？ Well, let me get a taste of one…
… Aww, yes！
Why do you look so shocked？
Because, you know, these taste like something you'd pay high dollar for in a store.
Hehe. So what kind of cookies should I make next？
… Oh, another type？ Hmm. Do you think you can make more than cookies？
Nope. I only know how to make cookies.
Rinko
You know that vacant lot behind the school？
Oh. That place littered by weeds and bushes？
That's the one. There was a kitten abandoned there.
Abandoned cats… There are a lot of them these days. It's really sad.
I know, right？ I don't understand how you can throw away such a cute critter.
I'm sure the original owners had their own circumstances, but I could not just throw them away.
That's why Rinko is thinking of secretly keeping it in the school.
Are you sure that's a good idea？ The teachers would find you out.
They already found out.
I knew it. So, what happened？
I was running around the school with the kitten…
The teacher who caught me decided to give in and help find the owner.
I have a feeling that's not all of the story…
Rinko
We found a new home for that kitten I was talking to you about.
That's good！
… Yeah.
You don't look too thrilled.
It wasn't easy for Rinko to let her go… It's still so tiny.
Then why don't you go to the owner's house and ask if you can still pet and play with her？
If you do that, she'll get attached to you and won't be able to leave you.
Well… let's just pray that the kitten will be happy and loved dearly.
… Yeah. That's what would ultimately be best for her, right？
Rinko
I heard from the school nurse that the kitten is sick right now.
Huh！？
The original owner didn't even get the kitten her vaccines or other shots.
That's terrible！ … How are you holding up about this？
… The nurse said that it's not looking good.
If that sweet little girl is… What should Rinko do？
Pull yourself together, ▲小早川＊▲. You have to believe in her.
… Yeah.
I'll be fine. They said she's being taken to a vet as she should have been anyway, now.
Yeah… that's right. I'll encourage you as best as I can.
Rinko
There is a god who cares about cats in this world. I'm shaken beyond all reason！
Oh？ The kitten pulled through？
Yes. I wonder if Rinko's prayer was answered by the cat gods？
Cat gods？ … Maybe so.
And then… hehe.
There's more to it？
I got a picture of her from her current owner. She's so healthy and so cute～…
I'd like to get a cat… I just can't right now.
I hope I can live surrounded by many cats in the future.
In the future？ Or…
Hey！ What's wrong with you？
Hehe. I'm counting on that from you, okay？
Rinko
Hey, I have a question. What kind of books have you been reading lately？
I, erm… I haven't been reading a lot of books.
Fired from the library committee.
Well, what about you, ▲小早川＊▲？ What have you been reading？
Recently I've been reading some German literature, including "The Sorrows of Young Werther".
German literature？ … What's the story about？
It's a story of a young man who falls in love for the first time and sorrows over his unfulfilled love.
I'll lend it to you when I'm done reading it.
… I don't want to get absorbed by his character and fall into despair, too.
Rinko
What's wrong？ You look so solemn.
The story was much heavier than I anticipated.
Oh. "The Sorrows of Young Werther", right？
The main character is a young man who falls in love with a beautiful woman who's engaged.
But he can't fulfill his love. So as a result, he despairs everything and commits suicide.
That's… tragic.
I'm curious What do you think of love that never comes to fruition？
I don't want to. I can't imagine having to go through all of that.
I see. For you, you can only imagine a smooth sailing life.
It's not that. It's just that I'm in love.
… Idiot. What are you on about？
Hey. Are you still reading that book？ The… Werther one.
Rinko
It's got me concerned. I'm almost finished. The more I read, the more hopeless I become.
When it was first began publication, there were stories of young people committing suicide, too.
Why didn't they play games or something to get their minds off it before they fell into all the despair？
I guess there was no gaming back then…
What would you do if… Rinko was so desperate that she became sick of everything…？
You can't fall into the same despair.
You don't know that.
I told you that I'm by your side until the end. I won't let you fall into that eternal sadness.
Don't try to be so cool about it… hehe.
Rinko
Yawn～…
No sleep？
Yeah. I stayed up all night and just finished the book outright.
Oh, "The Young" something. What did you think？
Are you going to think you can claim to have read it all because of what Rinko's spoiled？
… You just called me right out.
If you're so invested, go read it yourself.
It's going to be a hard read… I don't know if I can force myself to read tragedies like that.
This story asks the philosophical questions about how to live through that kind of tragedy.
Huh. It's a philosophy I'd like to remain ignorant of for the rest of my life.
That's usually the case. You know things like that do happen in peoples' lives…
Right. But shouldn't you look forward to life where it's more fulfilling when that loves comes true？
… What are you smirking about？ Guhh, you're such an idiot.
Rinko
Hey. Have you heard about the new fast food restaurant？
No？ There's a new restaurant？
That's right. They're looking for part-time workers now.
That's all the rumors you're going to get.
They've said the uniform is cute.
Heh.
You're not interested？
Just in the uniform itself.
Hmm. What if Rinko were to wear that uniform？
I'm just joking. Don't conjure up so much imaginiation.
Rinko
That fast food place I was telling you about…
Yeah. Did you hear about the cute uniforms？
Uh-huh. They're definitely cute.
You went to see them？ You went out of your way？
No. We got a flyer advertising it.
So what did you think…？
It's not Rinko's cup of tea.
What difference does it make？ There's not that much difference compared to a waitress's uniform.
I'd like to see more venom than… cutesy stuff.
A place with a lot more of a punk style and music, too.
It would be such a restless place.
I don't know. Rinko's just fantasizing about the ideal place at this point…
Rinko
Do you know Kawamura-sensei？
She's that teacher that recently got married？ She's beautiful, and all the boys cried when they found out.
Boys… they're such idiots.
… Anyway, what about Kawamura-sensei？
She's going on maternity leave this month.
Huh. Already having a baby？
That's right. The girls are all in a hissy with each other about what they think the baby will look like.
That was quick. Isn't her husband build like a boulder？
Yeah. I've seen pictures of them together. It's a real case of Beauty and the Beast.
How do you think people see you and Rinko？
Am I that horrifying？
I don't know. But you're no dazzling Prince Charming.
… Yeah. I can't argue with that.
Rinco prefers a charming beast to a simple prince any day.
Rinko
You know, I keep thinking. I wonder is babies are hard to raise.
I've heard that Kwamura-sensei said child care was difficult, so she won't be returning to work.
That's a shame if it's true. She's a popular and good teacher.
I'm sure you're right. But I can kind of understand how difficult it is to raise a child.
▲小早川＊▲, do you have experience raising children？
… No, I don't.
Hey, wait a minute！ Didn't you ever help take care of a younger relative？
Oh, I see. … I should count my little brother, then？
That's what I was thinking.
He's generally so cute and unruly. But once he begins crying, he's a royal pain. He's a little monster then.
I can only imagine it would be harder with a newborn.
Yeah. If possible, I'd like you to not quit what you're doing with him. But I can't force you to keep doing it.
Rinko
… This is just the worst. This is the biggest pinch I've been in my entire life.
Wait. What's going on？
I have to give a speech in my next English class.
Doesn't that mean you were carefully selected？
People know that Rinko likes western music…
Oh. So, that's why？
Listening to it being spoken and actually speaking it are entirely different from one another.
But it's been decided, right？
… You've got Rinko's back, right？
Aside from the preperation, the speech is the real issue.
… This is going to suck.
Hey, how did your English speech go？
Rinko
… it's done.
Well, come on. Fill me in. I want to know how it went.
Yeah. I don't think it turned out bad. It was even complimented.
That's great！ What did you speak on？
I quoted the lyrics from Killer Bambies… stuff about their worldview.
Hmm. Give me a description？
In short, I love Killer Bambies. When it's material you love, it's easy to talk about, right？
Yeah, I can get that. It's like when ▲小早川＊▲ talks about her love for cats.
Right. Your turn. Tell me how much you like Rinko.
… Er, why is that？
Oh, I get it… You just don't care for Rinko that much after all.
How did we get here…？
Er, ehm, uhh…
（You may do well in speeches, but not in acting…）
Rinko
The girls in the library committee decided to have a reading session.
Like a reading group？ We're all going to get together and read a book？
Not like that. They said they're going to volunteer to read books to the preschoolers.
We're not going to have to do that too, are we？
Yup. Well, just the girls, first.
Huh. To think I beleived ▲小早川＊▲ wouldn't be involved with that stuff.
Oh, so there's your prejudice. No, it's fun to think about what kind of books the kids would like.
Come to think of it, I read to my little brother at home, too.
Seeing the sparkle in his eyes and the way he listens makes Rinko happy, too.
Plus, if it makes you like books, that's a good thing.
That's right. It's a big undertaking.
Rinko
The reading session the other day was quite popular.
Oh, that's great. What kind of books did you read to the kids？
I thought a short picture book would be a good start. So I decided on a book called "The Fox's Journey".
I've never heard of it. What's it about？
It's a story about a little fox who goes on his first shopping trip and has many adventures. Boys like it.
The teacher and even my mom asked that I do it again next time. Hehe.
▲小早川＊▲, do you think you might have what it takes to be a nursery school teacher？
Maybe？ Come to think of it, kids these days are so smart. That surprised me.
So maybe that's a plan？
I was asked if my sister had a boyfriend. By some four-year-olds！
Four-year-olds…？ Asking that kind of question？
I said I'd show them a photo of my sister's boyfriend the next time I came. So I need your photo.
（Don't make me so nervous…）
